title: Masking Human Scent on Traps
brief: Remove or mask human scent to prevent animals from detecting and avoiding traps.
steps: Step 1: Use gall bladder fluid and urine from previous kills to coat hands and trap parts (never use human urine).
Step 2: Coat hands and trap with mud from areas with rotting vegetation.
Step 3: Smoke trap parts over a fire - animals associate smoke with natural fires, not human presence.
Step 4: If time permits, let traps weather outdoors for several days before setting (do not handle during weathering).
Step 5: Remove all fresh dirt if you must dig - carry it away from the area completely.
Step 6: Prepare trap parts away from the actual site, then carry them in and assemble quickly.
warnings: Even slight human scent will cause most mammals to avoid the area entirely.
Fresh-cut vegetation 'bleeds' sap that creates alarming odors for animals.
Birds have poor smell but mammals depend on scent more than sight.
